intro: Euphorbia popayanensis, commonly known as the Popayán spurge, is a succulent plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish cyathia, which are specialized flower-like structures typical of the genus Euphorbia. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
